Reviews.Content: Decent hotel I emailed prior to arriving at the hotel asking them if checking in late would be okay (taking the evening train from Rome). They didn't have an issue. They also booked tickets to the Academia (Michaelangelo's David) and to the Uffizi for me. Keep in mind that you don't need to make reservations (and pay extra) during slow season.The breakfast is simple and adequate (2 cereals: granola and corn flakes; bread and a roll w/jam, nutella/noscita, and honey). Juice and milk. The room they gave me did not have a bathroom and shower, hence I had to use the one in the hallway. Not cool at all.The flat screen TV w/BBC and CNN was alright and the view of the city street was cool.The best thing about the hotel is location. For the following reasons:a) 15-20 minute walk to train station w/luggageb) 5 min walk to internet shop (on Via Guelfa)c) right outside the hotel is a grocery store where you can get fruit and snacks. Very nice.d) 10-15 minute walk to the Duomo and the Campanile.Location is great (and hence the name...hotel centro) and it's not that loud in the evenings which is nice. The walls aren't too thin but you can hear your neighbors when they talk loudly.Seems like a family run hotel, nice people.They ask you to turn in your hotel key when you leave to travel around for the day. Not a big deal.The elevator seems a little scary truth be told but it's really not that big of a deal.I stayed several nights and booked on expedia which had a 50 dollar off internet coupon code for booking 3 nights or more. that was a good deal.
Reviews.Author: elbudgetotraveler

Reviews.Content: Shower drain was slow This was hotel was a bargain, so I was not expecting much. The lobby smelled like cigarettes ( I expected this, after all I was in Europe ). The oversized keychain attached to the room key was GIGANTIC...it felt like it was 6 lbs ( abt 3 kg)...If you lose this key, I don't know what to tell you.When we walked into the room, I was greeted by a big burn mark on the carpet...a silly sloppy smoker must've passed out and dropped a lit cigar there. There's a safe in the closet, a tv ( with sticky buttons ) and lots of drawer space. The room was pretty spacious.We had a wierd experience with the shower...it was draining so slow that it started seeping through the carpet. The breakfast was pretty average...it was what it was: a holdover meal before lunch. The staff was very friendly and helpful...they even helped us reserve tickets for The Accademia and The Uffizi ( which are walking distance fr. this hotel )With the price I paid, the friendly staff and it's proximity to the major tourist sites, I'm willing to ignore that slow shower drain and cigarette smell.
Reviews.Author: MOrario

Reviews.Content: good location, but some flaws Room was clean - bathroom was huge by European standards. Street was very noisy at night and since there was no air conditioning, sleeping with the windows open was a bit of a challenge. Also seemed a bit smoky and a few mosquitos got in the room. Breakfast was ok - cereal, breads with spreads and coffee. However, the location was ideal - easy walking distance to the art museums, the Duomo, and other major sites.
Reviews.Author: saweb123

Reviews.Content: very small, noisy and smoky!       hall way where people could smoke outside the room
Reviews.Author: travelqueen83

Reviews.Content: Noisy and smelly! When we arrived at the hotel it took us about 3 attempts of ringing the bell to get buzzed in. TINY lift! The man at reception didn't give us any information (breakfast times etc). The corridor and the room stank of cigarette smoke.The room itself was at least clean. However, in Feb it was COLD!! The street below is very noisy right through the night and the shutters did not shut out the light (or noise!).The bathroom is tiny.The breakfast- very very basic. We bought food at the supermarket below and ate that instead!Not value for money- we stayed in much better hotels in Venice and Pisa for the same price.(It is close to the duomo though!)
Reviews.Author: katmod

Reviews.Content: Great location, friendly staff       View from our room
Reviews.Author: mpierce06

Reviews.Content: Good 2star hotel with nice people and great location This is a nice 2star hotel with average facilities. However, the people are quite helpful and friendly, so that you really enjoy your stay with them. The breakfast was included in our package and was quite OK and you may call it reach for a 2star hotel's breakfast. The location of the hotel is quite good as it is just near the Medici Chapel and Duomo. There is even a super market just next door to the hotel. Within 1 min walking there is also a square with many cheap but good restaurants.
Reviews.Author: Minhao

Reviews.Content: Very convenient We stayed for 2 nights at this small hotel. It is like Fort Knox to get into with a very small lift to get to reception which is on the 1st floor. Location was ideal for train travel and sights. If you walked down the street you could walk in a straight line through San lorenzo market, the Duomo, Piazza Republica and onto Ponte Vecchio. A supermarket located beside the hotel was also useful. The rooms were adequate in size with a bathroom with all necessities. It was clean with a ceiling fan, but no frills. But overall value for money as it cost less than 拢100 for 2nights.
Reviews.Author: uglybettyCountyDown

Reviews.Content: Great location Good average quality hotel in great location, within easy walking to the highlights of Florence.Tiny breakfast room with poor menu choices - no travel hints here, sorry.Don't use the lifts if you're at all claustophobic as they are tiny also.The hotel staff were very helpful  friendly. Had no problems leaving our luggage after checkout.
Reviews.Author: BrissyGirl-in-London

Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, full of character, fantastic location. I have just returned from a 3 night stay in Florence with my daughter. We booked the Hotel Centro on line with a little trepidation as it is only 2 star and some of the reviews were less than complimentary. We were absolutely delighted with the hotel. The location was excellent, in a small street a short distance from lots of attractions. The hotel is a bit difficult to find, because, although it had a lit sign outside, the entrance is a pair of large wooden doors with nothing written on them. Once inside, there are wrought iron gates, you press a button and they click open, you then pass through to either a small lift, or use the stairs to the hotel which is on the upper floors. The reception is very small, just a desk, but the staff were pleasant and helpful, although their English was very limited. The room was lovely, spacious, with good beds, extra pillows if needed, plenty of storage space and a safe which didn't cost anything to use. You just set it with your own 4 digit code. The bathroom had a shower cubicle, basin, toilet and bidet, but if you have a serious weight problem then you would have difficulties getting in and out of the shower as it was quite narrow. We were OK but I could see others having problems. From the outside, the windows of the hotel were old with dark wood shutters but inside were new UPVC double glazed units, which kept out the noise but didn't spoil the old look of the street and buildings from the outside. We loved it, we like places with character and have high standards of cleanliness and comfort while looking for value for money. All this was met by this hotel and we'd definitely stay again.
Reviews.Author: KMKS

Reviews.Content: The worse experience Ever I am a frequent traveler to Italy. Most of the time, I book my hotel online so I can compare prices and get the information about different hotels and read the review from people who stayed there before me.That is why I chose Hotel Centro, the location was perfect, the price was good and people said good thing about it, but I was WRONG!On arrival, we were forced to stay on the steps for over 30 minutes before we could get in, and when we got to the reception, we found out why. The girl at the reception said they had problem with their guests who did not wanted to move and that is why they had canceled our reservation. I just could not believe it, but she assured us that they had taken care of the problem and we could stay in a 3 star hotel only a block away from them. She called them to confirm the reservation and marked the location on a map.It took us 30 minutes to find the other hotel, because, first of all, the address was wrong, it was not 1 block away, but 4, and the hotel was not a 3 star, but 2 with outside bathrooms, disgustingly dirty and on the main street.They destroyed our visit to Florence since we had to spend the whole afternoon trying to find a decent hotel and we ended up staying at the IBIS at the airport since all the hotels in our budget level were fully booked.I had my sister visiting from the US and wanted to show her Florence and it's beauty by finding a hotel close to the historical section of town so we could easily walk to the places and rest in between. Our entire vacation was destroyed, and we ended up leaving Florence shortly after our arrival.This was just a nightmare and a disgusting lack of respect for customer.
Reviews.Author: Farhads_travel_map

Reviews.Content: Wonderful surprise I booked a single room for the bargain price of 49 euros, and I was pleasantly surprised. The hotel has 16 rooms on two floors of an old building in central Florence, 2 blocks north of the Duomo. (The great painter Raphael lived in this building.) It is a winding 10-15 minute walk from the main train station in Florence. I lucked out and received a superior room that had been completely renovated, with new honey cherry colored furniture, wall-to-wall carpet and 13 flat screen TV. The double bed was firm and comfortable. The room was large by European standards and very clean, and there was a full closet with personal safe. The newly renovated, completely tiled bathroom was sparkling clean. The bathroom and especially the shower were very small, as were the common spaces (the lounge has 1 sofa, period). The breakfast room is small, so you may have to wait if you go late. The night manager is wonderful and will talk your ear off at breakfast. There is a great grocery store next door, and the Mercato Centrale is a block away. The only downside is that the rooms receive almost no sunlight. This is a great find in a city full of overpriced, bad hotels.
Reviews.Author: tsl1965

Reviews.Content: good value Large, quiet room in good, secure location in lovely, old building in the centre of Florence.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Location, Location Hotel is in a great location. Very close to all major sights and away from major train station (which is doggy at night). Room was clean and staff were very friendly. Definite Value for money. Bonus of a convenient store located directly downstairs. I highly recommend this place.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: good value for a 2* We have just returned from a 3 day trip with Ryanair from Glasgow Prestwick to Florence from 20 - 23 Nov.'05.Usually,we go 3-4* but took a chance with this bargain.And very pleased we were too.For a 2* it was pretty good.Bedroom nice  large with shower room(some rooms have to use the bathroom in corridor).There are only 12 rooms so quite intimate. The breakfast is included -usual,cereal,rolls,juice  tea or coffee,perfectly adequate,really.We found the staff very approachable  friendly.Hotel is in a very good position,close to all landmarks - Duomo,Uffizi etc,so no complaints there.Our advice to tourists is to bring a torch as some of the churches are so dimly lit,that you end up paying for a few minutes'pay per viewto see the treasures better.A torch is also handy if a call of nature in the night means a wee visit to the bathroom.No need to put on a big light  waken your companion.Another thing,we have found that going a bit out of season means that the crowds are less,ditto the queues,you aren't bothered by the mossies and the trees have lost their leaves meaning that you can see the sights easier.And ,of course,you are not sweltered either!So,go to Florence,marvel in the history and maybe even go to the Centro Hotel.
Reviews.Author: weemaw

Reviews.Content: Guess is depends on the room I too, after reading the reviews, booked with some trepedation, but was pleasantly surprised. I thought this hotel was an excellent value. The room was fairly simple in decor but was fully equipped, clean and comfortable (complete with hair dryer and little soaps). The location is superb, a short walk from everything, and the staff were very helpful (even when we got lost and arrived at midnight). The only thing to be wary of is finding the hotel if you are driving.... the directions are not great and with all the one way streets it is not easy to get to (and even harder to get to the car park around the corner). Also parking: plan on 25 euro per day for parking.
Reviews.Author: onthroadagain

Reviews.Content: Pleasantly Surprised Having read the previous reviews, I booked into this hotel with some trepidation but I needn't have worried. The hotel is in an excellent location, with all major sites within a few minutes walk. The room was spacious and very clean with a larger than normal bathroom. The staff could not have been more welcoming or friendlier. The breakfast was the usual fare - cereal, bread and jam etc and the staff were attentive with tea, coffee and fresh supplies. In summary, considering location and price, I was very impressed with the Centro Hotel and would recommend it.
Reviews.Author: Saint_C

Reviews.Content: NEVER STAY AT THIS HOTEL This was simply the worst hotel we have ever stayed in. The room was a disgrace and falsely advertised. The staff were hostile and confrontational without any provocation at all, we had the worst holiday we have ever had and it has seriously tarnished our view of Florence and Italians.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Location Location Location
Reviews.Author: Dutch-Duo

Reviews.Content: No long legs here Dont stay at this hotel if your legs are long as you wont be able to use the wc. It is cramped with no room to turn around in. The shower is in the same room as the beds so there is no privacy at all between the end of the bed and the one step it takes to get into the shower.The breakfast room is very small so if you are in a hurry to go out try and get a table early.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
